img_text: The Washington Post 4h a 0 0 at's the portion of college students who could develo post-traumatic stress disorder from the 2016 election, a new study suggests. Women, racial minorities and non-Christians reported significantly more election-related distress that could lead to PTSD. Researcher Melissa Hagan said the anxiety stems from "helplessness and fear" about the election: “Young people can't stop thinking about it." STOOK SOURCE SAN FRANOISCO STATE UNVERSIT
